alert.note: Alert for San Juan County; Western Whatcom County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 22 at 7:30PM PST until December 22 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to three inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills near to just below zero. * WHERE...San Juan County, including Stuart Island, Waldron Island, Orcas Island, San Juan Island, Lopez Island, Blakely Island, and Decatur Island and Lowlands of western Whatcom County, including Point Roberts, Lummi Island, Bellingham, and Sumas. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 PM PST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to freezing rain and ice. Freezing rain and wind could result in tree damage and power outages. Cold wind chills can result in frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation likely to begin as snow before transitioning to sleet and freezing rain before finally becoming all rain. Very difficult travel conditions are possible overnight through at least Friday morning. Avoid travel if possible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions in Washington state, call 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: San Juan County; Western Whatcom County
